name: Blockade Runner

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Blockade Runner twice and the rooms are spacious and well appointed. Both times we have had trouble with the reservations web site which averages nightly prices and is not responsive to changes. The price on the room seemed reasonable, but the reservations agent never ever mentioned that some of the rooms have tubs and some showers only. I did not think to ask because the web site description never mentions this major difference. It describes different bed sizes and views, but not this critical point, which seems increasingly to be an issue as hotels remodel and find showers cheaper and more ADA compliant. When we checked in, we were given a noisy room, near a screaming baby and asked to move. We were given a second room and neither one had a tub. And none were available because the hotel was pretty well booked. So if this matters to you, ASK IN ADVANCE. The breakfast was included in the price and was so so in terms of quality and convenient. They are located on the beach but charge to rent beach chairs. That seems a bit chintzy.
reviews.title: Nice location and large rooms, but reservations not so good and few tubs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pretty nice hotel for the price that we paid. The free breakfast was good - food tasty and definitely straight off the pan because the hotel was packed. I found in a little odd that the room flooring was tiled but it didn't make a difference to my stay. The bathrooms are very nicely appointed and our dinner buffet there was excellent! Would definitely go again.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we were a small group of approximately 12-14 people, the staff @ the Blockade Runner were very accomodating and attentive to our every need. The food was superb and the service in the restaurant matched the food! For a beach get away it is tops!
reviews.title: Small Group Attention

reviews.text: We had a wonderful time. When we checked in we had a view over the pool which was nice, but we called and requested to change to have an oceanfront. The front desk was very accommodating and had staff to meet us at the new room. The stay included breakfast and we were able to enjoy a full breakfast and we dined outside in a covered, yet open area. It was a nice resort and I hope to return soon.
reviews.title: Nice Resort
A perfect weekend getaway.
reviews.text: We took a detour from Raleigh when were traveling for a convention. We got to the hotel pretty late and just walked in to see if a room was available. They booked our room at the online rate we saw, and they did it fast! Staff was friendly from the valet to the desk to the wait staff. The included breakfast was wonderful with plenty of cooked and fresh food. The grounds are well maintained. The location is amazing! We went to sleep with the sounds of the waves and woke to a beautiful sunrise. Went for a run on the beach, but got distracted by the amazing shells I found. The whole experience was perfect, and well worth the drive from Raleigh, even for just one day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We nearly did not stop to take a look from the road. However the sign was updated and said Boutique so I thought we should check it out. Well I am glad we did. It has been updated and has a cool little lobby. The courtyard has a nice pool and pool bar that also serves food. The room was beautiful. We stayed in a room that was updated in 2011 on the 6th floor. Amazing views and very roomy. The bathroom was small but tastefully updated with a rain shower. The coffeemaker in the room is kuerig and they do give you several pods. To our surprise the room rate, which was remarkable, included a breakfast buffet. It was very good - we had scrambled eggs with fresh spinach and tomatoes, vanilla french toast, great potatoes, very nice fresh fruit and delicious coffee. The beach was beautiful as were the grounds. The whole stay was a great surprise and we will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Wonderful Gem

reviews.text: Although they did a decent job of renovating the hotel a few years ago, they need to go just a little further. The outside remains virtually unchanged so don't be afraid when you first pull into the lot. The lobby and dining areas have been nicely updated. We had an oceanfront room which was a decent size; however, the bathroom was a little small (no sharing the bathroom vanity). Again, the reno needed to go a little further in the rooms - new bed for one thing. It had to be the worse bed we have ever slept on, very springing mattress and extremely loud. Seriously, the first night I kept waking myself up when I turned over - that loud. The breakfast was the usual breakfast buffet, nothing great but nothing bad either. We paid $30 for 2 chairs and 2 umbrellas, a little high considering we were there during the off season. So, all in all, the price we paid for the room and amenities was a little high considering the age of the hotel as well as the furnishings. The price is more keeping with a higher end hotel, the Blockade Runner is not a high end hotel. However, as it's one of only a few on Wrightsville, it the price fell into range.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The hotel was very nice and i have been in every hotel on wrightsville beach and this is the nicest one i have seen. But would i pay 450.00 in the summer time for this hotel, Hell No! I have stayed in five star hotels for less that are way better. The lobby was very nice, the breakfast was better then most and the room was not that bad. The bathroom was way to small for 330.00 in october and the room was not very big also. The bed was amazing and my wife and I both slept very good. The drinks are very over priced 15.00 for liquor, 7 dollars for a miller light! One thing this hotel could do to make things better would be to fire the valet staff. Every time i left i heard them being very unprofessional at one point my mom, grandmother and me waiting for our car and the valet staff talking about how they had pissed blood the night before and and had the attitude like we were bothering them, all the other staff was great! Over all the Hotel was nice just over priced for what you get
reviews.title: Nice Stay But Over Priced

reviews.text: Blockade was nice, room was nice, great view, clean, and the place really does look nicer inside than the aging exterior. The pool is relaxing, the beach is very nice ($30 for 2 chairs and an umbrella was a bit over the top tho), tho gardens were nice and there was free wifi.
reviews.title: Nice stay. Could be top notch, but....

reviews.text: But it had its faults that could not be overlooked and I think this takes away from a really great possibility of a first-class experience.
reviews.title: Wonderful Getaway

reviews.text: We have been visiting WB annually for 35+ years and have never looked twice at this hotel - mainly because of the exterior facade. Needless to say, we were shocked when we walked into the lobby - it is a great little oasis on a great beach. The lobby, pool area, gardens and beach are lovely. We arrived before check-in and our room was not ready, but they took a cell number and promised to call when it was ready. They called slightly before check-in time and by the time we made it to the front desk, our keys were ready and we were off to the room - great service. We opted for a room with a private balcony and I am very glad we did. The main building has 'juliette' balconies that really aren't balconies at all...but rather a balcony facade in front of sliding doors - no room to sit/stand. Our room was on the top floor of the other building and offered a large balcony with a chaise lounge and high-top seating. It was a perfect spot to enjoy the sunrise over coffee (Keurig in the room) or take an afternoon nap. I would highly suggest you pay the extra amount for a private balcony. The pool area was nice, clean and offered abundant seating. The beach chair/umbrella rental was as expected and the attendant made sure we had everything we needed. The complimentary valet was a plus and everyone we encountered was pleasant and eager to assist. The 'free' breakfast buffet was very good with multiple cold/hot selections. We dined at East for dinner on Saturday night and the food and presentation were very good although there are better restaurants on the island for the price. Room was nicely appointed and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was small and the pocket door was odd, but it didn't detract from the flow or usability. Although we typically stay on the north end of the island for our annual, longer trips, we would definitely return to this hotel for future long weekends.
reviews.title: Don't judge the hotel from the front!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at TBR for our anniversary and his birthday, and our 2-year-old son accompanied us. Every aspect of our stay was perfect. The staff is gracious, friendly, and go the extra mile without even thinking about it. The food is delicious, the drinks are perfectly made and very potent. No watered down beverages at this place! The HUGE complimentary breakfast was a delight, and they make the best grits I've ever had. The poolside bar is my personal favorite amenity! I got to try ceviche for the first time, there.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything is clean and sparkling, which is no easy feat with the beach only a few yards away! Complimentary valet parking, knowledgeable concierge, complimentary SHUTTLE service to the local attractions, and just a nice, relaxed, family friendly atmosphere makes The Blockade Runner our favorite place to stay. Can't wait to come back next year!
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room wasn't ready at checkin but they were nice about it and had the room ready within ten minutes- 3pm. The lady next to me just didn't seem to understand why her room wasn't ready and was yelling at the poor front desk staff, saying she booked this room a full month ago (like that even has anything to do with it- were all rooms in her room type booked up the night before and did half the arrivals- like myself- already arrive before checkin time of 3pm? Meaning they already were rushing many rooms on a first come, first serve basis?!...sigh). Anyhow, from the front desk to the valet to the bartender- all were very cordial and warm. The hotel itself doesn't look like much from the outside but it looks like they spent a few million on a recent renovation- you can tell as some things looked older and some were newer. The grounds were nice and the beach was beautiful! Would go again. The included bkfst was also superb.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Location - Is in my opinion, the best thing about it. Being able to take the elevator down and step out onto the beach is really nice. You can walk to the restaurants and bars right in the heart of Wrightsville
reviews.title: Nice but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have never written a review of anything before, but felt so strongly about this hotel I had to do something. I booked a block of rooms here for my wedding. HUGE mistake. The rooms were not ready when the guests checked in. Once guests finally were settled in their rooms the hotel requested that several of them including the groom move to different rooms. They did not give me the Bridal suite that was promised to me in the contract, putting me in a different suite instead. They did not respond to service requests for ice and other items. I found cockroaches and dirty glasses in my room. The temperature control in the room did not work, there were apparently two settings frigid and off. But all of that pales in comparison to the way the staff treated me and my wedding guests. The lady that we had booked the rooms with, Particia, actually called my mother the day before the wedding to berate her and to tell her that our guests (paying customers of the hotel) could not use the hotel access to get to the beach where the ceremony was being held, all because we were not having our reception at the hotel (i.e., they weren't making an additional profit beyond the 34 rooms we booked). When I spoke to the manager and explained to him that every guest of the hotel uses that access to get to the beach and ours would too, he was less than obliging. I should mention that all of the details about the wedding were made known to the hotel when we signed the contract for the block of rooms, and the hotel made no mention of any concerns at that time. The staff or "Blockade Runner Police" as I now refer to them, harassed each of our vendors as they arrived on site, often before they even had a chance to park their cars. In short, the staff of this hotel were extremely rude and seem to lack a fundamental understanding of how businesses work. They did everything in their power to ruin my wedding, so brides beware!!! DO NOT choose this hotel for your wedding.
reviews.title: Worst hotel ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved my stay at the Blockade Runner. We had a lovely dinner on Friday evening sitting outside at their restaurant. There was a vegan item on the menu which is much appreciated.
reviews.title: Wonderful, restful weekend at the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning we took advantage of their yoga class out on the lawn by the ocean. The garden plantings were really beautiful and we felt that we were in a special place
reviews.title: A historically great hotel that just keeps getting better!

reviews.text: I had been to this hotel many years ago and the renovation is very nice. I think the bathroom window where you would expect a mirror was a little strange but the shower was great which is more important. I think the beach chairs and umbrellas should be part of the price which is not cheap but overall it was just wonderful . Oh and the breakfast was really good and included.
reviews.title: Stay away - BED BUGS!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My first visit to the Blockade Runner Resort was in the summer of 1973 and have enjoyed visiting off and on for the last 40 years.My latest visit once again was wonderful in every way,with much gratitude going to front end manager Andi Cornelius who's commitment to excellence is evident and love of the hotel is contagious to all that visit! From the meticulously maintained grounds, and immaculate poolside and patio,to the exceptional staff that is genuinely pleasant and ready to fulfill your every need. Oceanside and soundside beauty abound at every turn.The entire hotel is exquisitely decorated with keen attention to detail, contemporary and chic while staying true to the "Grand Dame's" mid-century modern roots. They will be celebrating their 50th anniversary in the upcoming year! Stop by the gift shop for unique fashion and locally made one of a kind gifts! They also support local artists! Do yourself a favor and do not miss this coastal paradise between the sound and the sea!
reviews.title: On the beach....

description: The Blockade Runner is uniquely located on Wrightsville Beach Island, North Carolina’s accessible outer-bank. On the east side, the resort fronts the Atlantic Ocean with a wide sandy beach while the west side fronts an Intracoastal Waterway harbor and anchorage. The resort offers the most complete water related activities possible. Our famous Blockade Runner full service breakfast is included for all guest including groups (not applicable to cottage groups).
